instName: ﻿St. Teresa's Convent of the Franciscan Fathers
instNote: ﻿A community of reformed Franciscans of the stricter observance, have, since 1858, established a Convent at Teutopolis, Effingham co., Ill. They form a branch of the Westphalian Province of this Order.

instName: ﻿St. Teresa's Convent of the Franciscan Fathers
instNote: ﻿A community of reformed Franciscans of the stricter observance, have, since 1858, established a Convent at Teutopolis, Effingham co., Ill. They form a branch of the Westphalian Province of this Order.

instName: ﻿St. Francis Solanos, Residence of Franciscan Fathers
﻿St. Francis Solanos, Residence of Franciscan Fathers

instNote: ﻿Boys will find all the opportunities to prepare themselves for the holy priesthood. Therewith is, at present, also connected, the Seminary of the Diocese. The Rev. Fathers will spare no pains to give to the pupils entrusted to them a good and solid education. The Poor Sisters of St. Francis have the care of the whole management of the house and of the infirmary
affiliated: ﻿The Poor Sisters of St. Francis have the care of the whole management of the house and of the infirmary; under the direction of the Franciscan Fathers

instName: ﻿St. Joseph's Ursuline Convent and Young Ladies' Academy
instNote: ﻿This house was established 22d August, 1857. The course of instruction embraces all the branches usually taught in such institutes. Connected with the Academy is a Day and Parochial School

instName: ﻿Ursuline Convent, Female Academy, Boarding, and Day School
instNote: ﻿This institute was founded in the year 1860. Besides their Academy and Boaording School, in which the higher branches of a finished education are taught, the nuns conduct the Parish Schools of the congregations at Alton

instName: ﻿Young Ladies' Academy of the Immaculate Conception
instNote: ﻿This institution was opened on the 5th of Ocotber, 1859. The course instruction embraces all the branches usually taught in such institutions. Connected with the academy is the Parish School of the congregation at Belleville
affiliated: ﻿Under the direction of the Poor School-Sisters of Notre Dame

instName: ﻿Convent of the Sisters of St. Joseph
instNote: ﻿This institute was founded in the year 1861. Connected with this academy for young ladies is the Free School of the Township and the Parochial School
affiliated: ﻿Under the direction of the Poor School-Sisters of Notre Dame

instNote: ﻿The Sisters of Loretto commenced last September, a school in Cairo, Illinois, with the intention to erect, as soon as possible, a fine Institute, wherein all the families of Southern Illinois will have an opportunity to give their daughters, near at home, a thorough education, as will be given in any such institute

affiliated: ﻿Conducted by the Brothers of the Holy Cross
